Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
Quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing there is a field.I'll meet you there.When the soul lies down in that grassthe world is too full to talk about.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Between the Acts
Quote: Books are the mirrors of the soul.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina
Quote: I think... if it is true that there are as many minds as there are heads, then there are as many kinds of love as there are hearts.

Author: Victor Hugo
Quote: What Is Love? I have met in the streets a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, the water passed through his shoes and the stars through his soul

Author: Bob Marley
Quote: Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones
Quote: What do you want?""Just coffee. Black - like my soul.

Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind
Quote: Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel
Quote: Whatever you are physically...male or female, strong or weak, ill or healthy--all those things matter less than what your heart contains. If you have the soul of a warrior, you are a warrior. All those other things, they are the glass that contains the lamp, but you are the light inside.

Author: Daniel Defoe
Quote: The soul is placed in the body like a rough diamond, and must be polished, or the luster of it will never appear.

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: Hollywood is a place where they'll pay you a thousand dollars for a kiss and fifty cents for your soul. I know, because I turned down the first offer often enough and held out for the fifty cents.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Words are a pretext. It is the inner bond that draws one person to another, not words.

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre
Quote: Do you think, because I am poor, obscure, plain and little, I am soulless and heartless? You think wrong! - I have as much soul as you, - and full as much heart! And if God had gifted me with some beauty and much wealth, I should have made it as hard for you to leave me, as it is now for me to leave you!

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina
Quote: Rummaging in our souls, we often dig up something that ought to have lain there unnoticed.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.

Author: José Saramago,  Blindness
Quote: Inside us there is something that has no name, that something is what we are.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Goodbyes are only for those who love with their eyes. Because for those who love with heart and soul there is no such thing as separation.

Author: Colleen Hoover,  Point of Retreat
Quote: If I were a carpenter, I would build you a window to my soul. But I would leave that window shut and locked, so that every time you tried to look through it all you would see is your own reflection. You would see that my soul is a reflection of you.

Author: Muriel Spark,  The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
Quote: To me education is a leading out of what is already there in the pupil's soul.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: Beauty of whatever kind, in its supreme development, invariably excites the sensitive soul to tears.

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre
Quote: The soul, fortunately, has an interpreter - often an unconscious but still a faithful interpreter - in the eye.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Laughter is the sound of the soul dancing. My soul probably looks like Fred Astaire.

Author: Wole Soyinka,  The Lion and the Jewel
Quote: Romance is the sweetening of the soulWith fragrance offered by the stricken heart.

Author: Douglas Coupland,  The Gum Thief
Quote: I don't deserve a soul, yet I still have one. I know because it hurts.

Author: Fernando Pessoa,  The Book of Disquiet
Quote: My soul is impatient with itself, as with a bothersome child; its restlessness keeps growing and is forever the same. Everything interests me, but nothing holds me. I attend to everything, dreaming all the while. […]. I'm two, and both keep their distance — Siamese twins that aren't attached.

Author: Drew Barrymore
Quote: If you don't take risks, you'll have a wasted soul.

Author: Charles Dickens,  A Tale of Two Cities
Quote: I wish you to know that you have been the last dream of my soul.

Author: Lana Del Rey
Quote: I was always an unusual girl.My mother told me I had a chameleon soul, no moral compass pointing due north, no fixed personality; just an inner indecisiveness that was as wide and as wavering as the ocean.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Let today be the day you stop being haunted by the ghost of yesterday. Holding a grudge & harboring anger/resentment is poison to the soul. Get even with people...but not those who have hurt us, forget them, instead get even with those who have helped us.

Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Angel's Game
Quote: Every book has a soul, the soul of the person who wrote it and the soul of those who read it and dream about it.

Author: Natalie Goldberg,  Writing Down the Bones: Freeing the Writer Within
Quote: Write what disturbs you, what you fear, what you have not been willing to speak about. Be willing to be split open.

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre
Quote: Laws and principles are not for the times when there is no temptation: they are for such moments as this, when body and soul rise in mutiny against their rigour ... If at my convenience I might break them, what would be their worth?

Author: Victoria Moran,  Lit From Within: Tending Your Soul For Lifelong Beauty
Quote: To the people who love you, you are beautiful already. This is not because they’re blind to your shortcomings but because they so clearly see your soul. Your shortcomings then dim by comparison. The people who care about you are willing to let you be imperfect and beautiful, too. (20)

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: People tend to be generous when sharing their nonsense, fear, and ignorance. And while they seem quite eager to feed you their negativity, please remember that sometimes the diet we need to be on is a spiritual and emotional one. Be cautious with what you feed your mind and soul. Fuel yourself with positivity and let that fuel propel you into positive action.

Author: James Herriot,  All Creatures Great and Small
Quote: If having a soul means being able to feel love and loyalty and gratitude, then animals are better off than a lot of humans.

Author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas
Quote: Souls cross ages like clouds cross skies, an' tho' a cloud's shape nor hue nor size don't stay the same, it's still a cloud an' so is a soul. Who can say where the cloud's blowed from or who the soul'll be 'morrow? Only Sonmi the east an' the west an' the compass an' the atlas, yay, only the atlas o' clouds.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Sometimes your light shines so bright that it blinds people from seeing who you really are.

Author: Ayn Rand,  The Fountainhead
Quote: To sell your soul is the easiest thing in the world. That's what everybody does every hour of his life. If I asked you to keep your soul - would you understand why that's much harder?

Author: John O'Donohue,  Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom
Quote: Your soul knows the geography of your destiny. Your soul alone has the map of your future, therefore you can trust this indirect, oblique side of yourself. If you do, it will take you where you need to go, but more important it will teach you a kindness of rhythm in your journey.

Author: Charlie Chaplin
Quote: Your naked body should only belong to those who fall in love with your naked soul.

Author: Frederick Delius
Quote: Music is an outburst of the soul.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My brain is divided into two butterflies, and both are in love with your rose-shaped heart. If you've got the garden, I've got my whole life.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: She has a sly smile, and eyes that seem to see my essence as they explore my soul and implore my spirit to enter her. I look at her and I see love.

Author: Fernando Pessoa,  The Book of Disquiet
Quote: My soul is a hidden orchestra; I know not what instruments, what fiddlestrings and harps, drums and tamboura I sound and clash inside myself. All I hear is the symphony.

Author: Dave Pelzer,  A Child Called "It"
Quote: Childhood should be carefree, playing in the sun; not living a nightmare in the darkness of the soul.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Collected Poems
Quote: I am terrified by this dark thing that sleeps in me.

Author: Thomas Moore
Quote: It is only through mystery and madness that the soul is revealed

Author: Stephen King,  Under the Dome
Quote: She can't help it,' he said. 'She's got the soul of a poet and the emotional makeup of a junkyard dog.

Author: James Frey,  A Million Little Pieces
Quote: There is emotion in the hug, and there is respect and a form of love. Emotion that comes from honesty, respect that comes from challenge, and the form of love that exists between people whose minds have touched, whose hearts have touched, whose souls have touched. Our minds touched. Our hearts touched. Our souls touched.We separate.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My I love you was a measured response, like one gallon of coffee in one cup of sugar. It was just overflowing with an awakening of my soul.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I am the coffee, and God is The Barista. Through me, he may awaken your soul. But the coffee knows not what flows through the mind of The Barista.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Pilgrimage
Quote: We must never stop dreaming. Dreams provide nourishment for the soul, just as a meal does for the body.

Author: Federico García Lorca
Quote: But hurry, let's entwine ourselves as one, our mouth broken, our soul bitten by love, so time discovers us safely destroyed.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Re-examine all you have been told. Dismiss what insults your soul.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The harmonica has musical wind, and is the breath of soul. It’s like a sad, lonely I love you lost in the breeze.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Eleven Minutes
Quote: I'm not a body with a soul, I'm a soul that has a visible part called the body.

Author: Patti Roberts,  The Angels Are Here
Quote: Sometimes, the only soul that can mend a broken heart is the one that broke it. For they are the ones holding all the pieces.

Author: John O'Donohue,  Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom
Quote: Once the soul awakens, the search begins and you can never go back. From then on, you are inflamed with a special longing that will never again let you linger in the lowlands of complacency and partial fulfillment. The eternal makes you urgent. You are loath to let compromise or the threat of danger hold you back from striving toward the summit of fulfillment.

Author: Edith Wharton
Quote: There is one friend in the life of each of us who seems not a separate person, however dear and beloved, but an expansion, an interpretation, of one's self, the very meaning of one's soul.

Author: John O'Donohue,  Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom
Quote: Beauty is the illumination of your soul.

Author: Kami Garcia,  Beautiful Creatures
Quote: Dig deep. Find your way to your soul.

Author: Emery Allen
Quote: I feel like a part of my soul has loved you since the beginning of everything.Maybe we’re from the same star.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: When you give yourself permission to communicate what matters to you in every situation you will have peace despite rejection or disapproval. Putting a voice to your soul helps you to let go of the negative energy of fear and regret.

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Rilla of Ingleside
Quote: The body grows slowly and steadily but the soul grows by leaps and bounds. It may come to its full stature in an hour.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: You are a little soul carrying about a corpse, as Epictetus used to say.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  De Profundis
Quote: To regret one’s own experiences is to arrest one’s own development. To deny one’s own experiences is to put a lie into the lips of one’s own life. It is no less than a denial of the soul.

Author: V. Vale,  Modern Primitives: An Investigation of Contemporary Adornment and Ritual
Quote: A tattoo is a true poetic creation, and is always more than meets the eye. As a tattoo is grounded on living skin, so its essence emotes a poignancy unique to the mortal human condition.

Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  A Wizard of Earthsea
Quote: It is very hard for evil to take hold of the unconsenting soul.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: A respectable appearance is sufficient to make people more interested in your soul

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.
Quote: Hydrogenated and androgynous milky white love is all I have to offer you. Would you like me to pour it in your coffee, or directly into your soul?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: After soul searching, I found myself. Then I found myself giving of myself to a charity that finds missing children. It's great to be found.

Author: Allan Rufus,  The Master's Sacred Knowledge
Quote: Life is like a game of chess.To win you have to make a move.Knowing which move to make comes with IN-SIGHTand knowledge, and by learning the lessons that areacculated along the way.We become each and every piece within the game called life!

Author: Sharon Swan
Quote: If someone loves you, they should not be envious of you pouring your heart and soul and time and energy into the things that you are passionate about, but instead....they should love you MORE because you are so involved in those things.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My coffee cup is empty. Why don't you pour your love in and wake up my soul?

Author: Bree Despain,  The Dark Divine
Quote: That's what makes it so right. Your eyes—your soul is there, but the rest of you is still so undefined. That's the beauty of childhood. The eyes show everything you've seen so far, but the rest of you is still so open to possibility, to whatever you might become.

Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett,  A Little Princess
Quote: How it is that animals understand things I do not know, but it is certain that they do understand. Perhaps there is a language which is not made of words and everything in the world understands it. Perhaps there is a soul hidden in everything and it can always speak, without even making a sound, to another soul.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: So the unwanting soulsees what's hidden,and the ever-wanting soulsees only what it wants.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray
Quote: There is no such thing as a good influence. Because to influence a person is to give him one's own soul. He does not think his natural thoughts, or burn with his natural passions. His virtures are not real to him. His sins, if there are such thing as sins, are borrowed. He becomes an echo of someone else's music, an actor of a part that has not been written for him.

Author: Gustave Flaubert,  November
Quote: Everyone, either from modesty or egotism, hides away the best and most delicate of his soul’s possessions; to gain the esteem of others, we must only ever show our ugliest sides; this is how we keep ourselves on the common level

Author: Dom Hubert Van Zeller
Quote: What the soul hardly realizes is that, unbeliever or not, his loneliness is really a homesickness for God.

Author: Anthony De Sa,  Barnacle Love
Quote: The Portuguese call it saudade: a longing for something so indefinite as to be indefinable. Love affairs, miseries of life, the way things were, people already dead, those who left and the ocean that tossed them on the shores of a different land — all things born of the soul that can only be felt.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: When we were we, with you is the only place I wanted to be. When we were just two separate souls, I used to dream of a place where we'd come together as one.-Jarod Kintz and Karen Quan

Author: Hilary Duff,  Devoted
Quote: Soulmate"is an overused term, but a true soul connection is very rare, and very real.

Author: Emery Allen
Quote: You don't need another Human Being to make your life complete, but let's be honest. Having your wounds kissed by someone who doesn't see them as disasters In your soul, but cracks to put their love into, Is the most calming thing In this World.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: Whatever happens to your body, your soul will survive, untouched...

Author: Deepak Chopra,  Life After Death: The Burden of Proof
Quote: What keeps life fascinating is the constant creativity of the soul.

Author: Vincent van Gogh
Quote: There may be a great fire in our soul, yet no one ever comes to warm himself at it, and the passers-by see only a wisp of smoke.

Author: Anthon St. Maarten,  Divine Living: The Essential Guide To Your True Destiny
Quote: You are one thing only. You are a Divine Being. An all-powerful Creator. You are a Deity in jeans and a t-shirt, and within you dwells the infinite wisdom of the ages and the sacred creative force of All that is, will be and ever was.

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: Beauty is the purest feeling of the soul. Beauty arises when soul is satisfied.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.
Quote: Reading a book is like having the ability to dip a straw into the author’s soul and sip and slurp without lowering the water table of wisdom.

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre
Quote: And it is you, spirit--with will and energy, and virtue and purity--that I want, not alone with your brittle frame.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: The wise do not buy into other people’s perceptions of who they are and what they are capable of. Instead, they bypass a person’s public persona and see who they are in their highest expression. When you see actions taken with integrity, instead of words only, you will then know a soul’s worth.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: I drink to separate my body from my soul.

Author: Ma Jaya Sati Bhagavati,  The 11 Karmic Spaces: Choosing Freedom from the Patterns That Bind You
Quote: Quiet the mind, and the soul will speak.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I love deeply. I love long. I love wide and high. That's right, my love is interdimensional, and my vortex will heal your body and soul.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Quote: You can exist without your soul, you know, as long as your brain and heart are still working. But you’ll have no sense of self anymore, no memory, no . . . anything. There’s no chance at all of recovery. You’ll just — exist. As an empty shell. And your soul is gone forever . . . lost.

Author: Thomas Moore,  Care of the Soul: Guide for Cultivating Depth and Sacredness in Everyday Life
Quote: Disappointments in love, even betrayals and losses, serve the soul at the very moment they seem in life to be tragedies. The soul is partly in time and partly in eternity. We might remember the part that resides in eternity when we feel despair over the part that is in life.

Author: Colbie Caillat
Quote: A great song should lift your heart, warm the soul and make you feel good.

Author: William James,  The Principles of Psychology
Quote: Seek out that particular mental attribute which makes you feel most deeply and vitally alive, along with which comes the inner voice which says, 'This is the real me,' and when you have found that attitude, follow it.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451
Quote: Everyone must leave something behind when he dies . . . Something your hand touched some way so your soul has somewhere to go when you die . . . It doesn't matter what you do, so long as you change something from the way it was before you touched it into something that's like you after you take your hands away.

Author: Melissa de la Cruz
Quote: Who knew that the path to a womans heart was through the soul of an honest man?

Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables
Quote: There is one spectacle grander than the sea, that is the sky; there is one spectacle grander than the sky, that is the interior of the soul.

Author: ليلى الجهني,  40 في معنى أن أكبر
Quote: الذي ينهك روحي أن أكون مع الناس طوال الوقت ، أو لفترات طويلة

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: Don’t worry if people think you’re crazy. You are crazy. You have that kind of intoxicating insanity that lets other people dream outside of the lines and become who they’re destined to be.

Author: John O'Donohue
Quote: One of the deepest longings of the human soul is to be seen.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: If life is a journey then let my soul travel and share your pain.

Author: Edward Abbey
Quote: Sentiment without action is the ruin of the soul.

Author: G.K. Chesterton,  A Chesterton calendar
Quote: The object of a New Year is not that we should have a new year. It is that we should have a new soul and a new nose; new feet, a new backbone, new ears, and new eyes. Unless a particular man made New Year resolutions, he would make no resolutions. Unless a man starts afresh about things, he will certainly do nothing effective.

Author: Gustave Flaubert
Quote: There are two infinities that confuse me: the one in my soul devours me; the one around me will crush me

Author: Toba Beta,  Master of Stupidity
Quote: Crying relieves pressure on soul.

Author: Michel Faber,  The Crimson Petal and the White
Quote: A single day spent doing things which fail to nourish the soul is a day stolen, mutilated, and discarded in the gutter of destiny.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I want to be the best version of myself for anyone who is going to someday walk into my life and need someone to love them beyond reason.

Author: April Genevieve Tucholke,  Between the Devil and the Deep Blue Sea
Quote: Sunshine, if I ever disappear, please tell people that I ran after the Devil, trying to get my soul back.

Author: Stephenie Meyer,  The Host
Quote: I wanted the monster back and that was plainly wrong.

Author: John Vance Cheney
Quote: The soul would have no rainbow, had the eyes no tears.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: Idris: Are all people like this?The Doctor: Like what?Idris: So much bigger on the inside.

Author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha
Quote: Dreams and restless thoughts came flowing to him from the river, from the twinkling stars at night, from the sun's melting rays. Dreams and a restlessness of the soul came to him.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: This is thy hour O Soul, thy free flight into the wordless, Away from books, away from art, the day erased, the lesson done,Thee fully forth emerging, silent, gazing, pondering the themes thou lovest best. Night, sleep, and the stars.

Author: Arthur Rimbaud
Quote: But the problem is to make the soul into a monster

Author: Alexander Pope,  The Rape of the Lock
Quote: Beauties in vain their pretty eyes may roll; Charms strike the sight, but merit wins the soul.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Eat, fast, and then eat fast. It’s a diet for both the body and the soul.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I am never alone wherever I am. The air itself supplies me with a century of love. When I breathe in, I am breathing in the laughter, tears, victories, passions, thoughts, memories, existence, joys, moments, and the hues of the sunlight on many tones of skin; I am breathing in the same air that was exhaled by many before me. The air that bore them life. And so how can I ever say that I am alone?

Author: Thomas Mann,  The Magic Mountain
Quote: Laughter is a sunbeam of the soul.

Author: Jeremy Aldana
Quote: If my eyes have pain, I close them; If my body aches, I rest it; If my heart breaks, I mend it; If my soul is lost, I pray for it

Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Invincible
Quote: The wealth of a soul is measured by how much it can feel... its poverty by how little.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: I could be in the middle of a spiritual hurricane, my soul torn and tormented, but when I see you smile it's blue skies for miles. You give me a tsunami of emotions, and my heart is trying to find peace through crashing waves, but they always end up in a cyclone that never dies.-Jarod Kintz and Karen Quan

Author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Smile Anyway: Quotes, Verse, & Grumblings for Every Day of the Year
Quote: A daily dose of daydreaming heals the heart, soothes the soul, and strengthens the imagination.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: Our birth is but a sleep and a forgetting:The Soul that rises with us, our life's Star,Hath had elsewhere its setting,And cometh from afar:Not in entire forgetfulness,And not in utter nakedness,But trailing clouds of glory do we come

Author: Tom Stoppard,  Rock 'n' Roll
Quote: I am not my body. My body is nothing without me.

Author: Langston Hughes
Quote: I've known rivers:I've known rivers ancient as the world and older than the flow of human blood in human veins.My soul has grown deep like the rivers.

Author: Nancy Farmer,  The House of the Scorpion
Quote: I love you,"Matt said.I love you, too,"Maria replied. "I know that's a sin, and I'll probably go to hell for it."If I have a soul, I'll go with you,"promised Matt.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  Long After Midnight
Quote: But souls can't be sold. They can only be lost and never found again.

Author: Brian L. Weiss,  Muchas Vidas, Muchos Maestros
Quote: Inner peace is impossible without patience. Wisdom requires patience. Spiritual growth implies the mastery of patience. Patience allows the unfolding of destiny to proceed at its won unhurried pace.

Author: Allan Rufus
Quote: Life is like a sandwich!Birth as one slice,and death as the other.What you put in-between the slices is up to you.Is your sandwich tasty or sour?Allan Rufus.org

Author: Amit Ray
Quote: Do not live in the shadow of the masters for ever. Learn to live in the light of your soul. Life deserves full expression.

Author: Roman Payne,  Cities & Countries
Quote: This was how it was with travel: one city gives you gifts, another robs you. One gives you the heart’s affections, the other destroys your soul. Cities and countries are as alive, as feeling, as fickle and uncertain as people. Their degrees of love and devotion are as varying as with any human relation. Just as one is good, another is bad.

Author: Horace,  The Odes of Horace: Bilingual Edition
Quote: Caelum non animum mutant qui trans mare currunt.(They change their sky, not their soul, who rush across the sea.)

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: Your soul is oftentimes a battlefield, upon your reason and your judgment wage war against your passion and your appetite.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: If you want to discover the true character of a person, you have only to observe what they are passionate about.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: Yoga means addition - addition of energy, strength and beauty to body, mind and soul.

Author: Mary Doria Russell,  Children of God
Quote: How can you hear your soul if everyone is talking?

Author: Ray Lamontagne,  Ray Lamontagne and the Pariah Dogs - God Willin' & the Creek Don't Rise
Quote: Now the wren has gone to roost and the sky is turnin' goldAnd like the sky my soul is also turnin'Turnin' from the past, at last and all I've left behind

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: For so many years, I couldn’t understand why every time I thought that someone finally loved me, like… for real, they would eventually turn to vapor. Every person whom I’ve ever loved is trapped inside of my chest. I’ve breathed all of them in so deeply that I’ve nearly choked and died on every soul that I’ve ever given myself to.

Author: William Hazlitt,  Essays of William Hazlitt: Selected and Edited, with Introduction and Notes, by Frank Carr
Quote: Books let us into their souls and lay open to us the secrets of our own."[The Sick Chamber (The New Monthly Magazine , August 1830)]

Author: Thomas More
Quote: The many great gardens of the world, of literature and poetry, of painting and music, of religion and architecture, all make the point as clear as possible: The soul cannot thrive in the absence of a garden. If you don't want paradise, you are not human; and if you are not human, you don't have a soul.

Author: Amit Ray,  Yoga and Vipassana: An Integrated Life Style
Quote: Yoga is the art work of awareness on the canvas of body, mind, and soul.

Author: John Calvin
Quote: The torture of a bad conscience is the hell of a living soul.

Author: Lang Leav,  Love & Misadventure
Quote: The WandererWhat is she like?I was told—she is amelancholy soul.She is likethe sun to the night;a momentary gold.A star when dimmedby dawning light;the flicker ofa candle blown.A lonely kitelost in flight—someone oncehad flown.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  Complete Works of Oscar Wilde
Quote: To be really mediæval one should have no body. To be really modern one should have no soul. To be really Greek one should have no clothes.

Author: Renee Carlino,  Sweet Thing
Quote: Tears had poured from her eyes without any change in her facial expression. It’s pure pain and pure surrender when your soul cries without any fight from your body and that’s how I knew she was deeply affected.

Author: Thomas Moore,  Care of the Soul: Guide for Cultivating Depth and Sacredness in Everyday Life
Quote: It may help us, in those times of trouble, to remember that love is not only about relationship, it is also an affair of the soul.

Author: Heidi W. Durrow,  The Girl Who Fell from the Sky
Quote: A woman made of parts is a dangerous thing. You never know when she'll throw away a piece you may need.

Author: J.M. Coetzee,  Disgrace
Quote: His own opinion, which he does not air, is that the origin of speech lie in song, and the origins of song in the need to fill out with sound the overlarge and rather empty human soul.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  De Profundis
Quote: The final mystery is oneself. When one has weighed the sun in the balance, and measured the steps of the moon, and mapped out the seven heavens star by star, there still remains oneself. Who can calculate the orbit of his own soul?

Author: Roman Payne,  Rooftop Soliloquy
Quote: I regained my soul through literature after those times I'd lost it to wild-eyed gypsy girls on the European streets.

Author: Gérard de Nerval
Quote: Every flower is a soul blossoming in nature.

Author: Neal Shusterman,  Unwind
Quote: I was asking if unwinding kills you, or if it leaves you alive somehow. C'mon—it's not like we haven't thought about it."(...)What do you think, Connor?"asks Hayden. "What hap­pens to your soul when you get unwound?"Who says I even got one?"For the sake of argument, let's say you do."Who says I want an argument?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  liQUID PROse QUOtes
Quote: The sunset produces flower clouds in a garden in the sky, and while there is still light you can see a heavenly representation of my love for you.The sunrise produces rays that light up the world like your eyes do when you're with me. They shimmer and I can see the stars in your eyes that gleam from your soul.-Jarod Kintz and Karen Quan

Author: Brené Brown
Quote: Maybe stories are just data with a soul.

Author: Michelle Casto
Quote: The only person who is spiritually smart is the one who has learned how to learn, unlearn, and change directions instantly, and start all over again, if your soul calls for it.

Author: Rudolf Steiner,  Theosophy: An Introduction to the Spiritual Processes in Human Life and in the Cosmos
Quote: Just as in the body, eye and ear develop as organs of perception, as senses for bodily processes, so does a man develop in himself soul and spiritual organs of perception through which the soul and spiritual worlds are opened to him. For those who do not have such higher senses, these worlds are dark and silent, just as the bodily world is dark and silent for a being without eyes and ears.

Author: Ma Jaya Sati Bhagavati,  The 11 Karmic Spaces: Choosing Freedom from the Patterns That Bind You
Quote: When you plant a seed of love, it is you that blossoms.

Author: Isadora Duncan
Quote: Now I am going to reveal to you something which is very pure, a totally white thought. It is always in my heart; it blooms at each of my steps... The Dance is love, it is only love, it alone, and that is enough... I, then, it is amorously that I dance: to poems, to music but now I would like to no longer dance to anything but the rhythm of my soul.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I can do this… I can start over. I can save my own life and I’m never going to be alone as long as I have stars to wish on and people to still love.

Author: Rubén Darío
Quote: You are an Universe of Universes and your soul a source of songs.

Author: Anne Rice,  Pandora
Quote: The finest thing under the sun and moon is the human soul. I marvel at the small miracles of kindness that pass between humans, I marvel at the growth of conscience, at the persistence of reason in the face of all superstition or despair. I marvel at human endurance.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: Lord help my poor soul.

Author: Ivan Doig,  The Whistling Season
Quote: Childhood is the one story that stands by itself in every soul.

Author: Nikolai A. Berdyaev
Quote: Every single human soul has more meaning and value than the whole of history.

Author: Kelly Cutrone,  If You Have to Cry, Go Outside: And Other Things Your Mother Never Told You
Quote: Dreams won't always take you on a straight path to destiny but they're usually related to what your soul wants for you. They'll force you to ask yourself the hard questions, they'll kick your ass and more importantly, they'll turn you on.

Author: أحمد خالد توفيق,  يوتوبيا
Quote: الابتزاز لعبة من تعفنت روحه

Author: Bohumil Hrabal,  I Served the King of England
Quote: He was a gentle and sensitive soul, and therefore had a short temper, which is why he went straight after everything with an ax...

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: You can have regret from yesterday, fear tomorrow, but peace today by sharing your heart’s deepest feelings. A life spent being fearful of showing your soul is a life not worth living.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: When you touch the celestial in your heart, you will realize that the beauty of your soul is so pure, so vast and so devastating that you have no option but to merge with it. You have no option but to feel the rhythm of the universe in the rhythm of your heart.

Author: Chaim Potok
Quote: Two people who are true friends are like two bodies with one soul

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: The heart of an Irishman is nothing but his imagination

Author: Kasie West,  The Fill-In Boyfriend
Quote: We rarely find a depth by looking inside of ourselves for it. Depth is found in what we can learn from the people and things around us. Everyone, everything, has a story, Gia. When you learn those stories, you learn experiences that fill you up, that expand your understanding. You add layers to your soul.

Author: Charles Bukowski,  You Get So Alone at Times That it Just Makes Sense
Quote: the worst thing,"he told me,"is bitterness, people end up sobitter.

Author: Amy Winehouse
Quote: I couldn't resist him, his eyes were like yours, his hair was exactly the shade of brown.He's just not as tall, but I couldn't tell, it was dark and I was lying down.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Emotion is always multiplied in the art of a person who doesn't really show much emotion. It once expanded deep within his hidden soul, and following the downplay his audience is blown away.

Author: Joseph Grenny
Quote: I believe that the measure of my soul is my capacity to love imperfect people.

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: Write it on your heart you are the most beautiful soul of the Universe. Realize it, honor it and celebrate the life.

Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Acheron
Quote: It's easy to look at people and make quick judgements about them, their present and their pasts, but you'd be amazed at the pain and tears a single smile hides. what a person shows to the world is only one tiny facet of the iceburg hidden from sight. And more often then not, it's lined with cracks and scars that go all the way to the foundation of their soul.

Author: John O'Donohue,  Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom
Quote: All you can ever achieve is a sense of your soul. You gain little glimpses of its light, colors, and contours. You feel the inspiration of its possibilities and the wonder of its mysteries.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Vanishing Acts
Quote: Memories aren't stored in the heart or the head or even the soul, if you ask me, but in the spaces between any given two people.

Author: John Coltrane
Quote: My music is the spiritual expression of what I am — my faith, my knowledge, my being...When you begin to see the possibilities of music, you desire to do something really good for people, to help humanity free itself from its hangups...I want to speak to their souls.

Author: Paul Bowles,  The Sheltering Sky
Quote: The soul is the weariest part of the body.

Author: Rumi
Quote: When soul risesInto lipsYou feel the kiss You have wanted

Author: Anton Chekhov,  Selected Stories
Quote: They say philosophers and wise men are indifferent. Wrong. Indifference is a paralysis of the soul, a premature death.

Author: Maria V. Snyder,  Poison Study
Quote: I peered deeper and found my soul. A little tattered and with some holes, but there all the same. It had always been there, I realized with shock.

Author: Christine Feehan,  Turbulent Sea
Quote: She didn't know how to love, to give herself to someone, to out herself in someone else's keeping and take him into hers. She didn't trust anyone with her heart - or the darker places of her soul.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: Once conform, once do what other people do because they do it, and a lethargy steals over all the finer nerves and faculties of the soul. She becomes all outer show and inward emptiness; dull, callous, and indifferent.

Author: Harley King
Quote: I feel the healinghands of Godtouch my heartand kiss my soul.

Author: Amit Ray,  Om Chanting and Meditation
Quote: Penetrate deep into the word "Om". Gradually the word will disappear and only the silence will remain. The word is a support. The meaning is within you. Om brings out that meaning which is hidden in your soul.

Author: George Gordon Byron
Quote: The light of love, the purity of grace,The mind, the Music breathing from her face, The heart whose softness harmonised the whole —And, oh! that eye was in itself a Soul!

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: A broken soul is not the absence of beauty, but a cracked and torn soul reeks of the sweet incense it contains.

Author: Brian L. Weiss
Quote: More learning can occur when there are many obstacles then when thear are few or none. A life with difficult relationships, filled with obstacles and losses, presents the most opportunity for the soul's growth. You may have chosen the more difficult life so that you could accelerate your physical progress

Author: Pablo Neruda,  The Book of Questions
Quote: Donde termina el arco iris,en tu alma o en el horizonte?Where does the rainbow end,in your soul or on the horizon?

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: Give time, give space to sprout your potential. Awaken the beauty of your heart – the beauty of your spirit. There are infinite possibilities.

Author: Shauna Niequist,  Bittersweet: Thoughts on Change, Grace, and Learning the Hard Way
Quote: Many of the most deeply spiritual moments of my life haven't happened just in my mind or in my soul. They happened while holding my son in the middle of the night, or watching the water break along the shore, or around my table, watching the people I love feel nourished in all sorts of ways.

Author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha
Quote: ...and the vessel was not full, his intellect was not satisfied, his soul was not at peace, his heart was not still.

Author: C.G. Jung
Quote: The Wrong we have Done, Thought, or Intended Will wreak its Vengeance onOur SOULS.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I look out into the water and up deep into the stars. I beg the sparkling lanterns of light to cure me of myself — my past and the kaleidoscope of mistakes, failures and wrong turns that have stacked unbearable regret upon my shoulders.

Author: George Eliot,  The Mill on the Floss
Quote: Her future, she thought, was likely to be worse than her past, for after her years of contented renunciation, she had slipped back into desire and longing; she found joyless days of distasteful occupation harder and harder; she found the image of the intense and varied life she yearned for, and despaired of, becoming more and more importunate.

Author: Margaret Atwood
Quote: But my dreaming self refuses to be consoled. It continues to wander, aimless, homeless, alone. It cannot be convinced of its safety by any evidence drawn from my waking life.

Author: Alyson Noel,  Everlasting
Quote: Forgiveness is healing—everything is energy—thoughts create—we are all connected—what you resist persists—true love never dies—the soul’s immortality is the only true immortality—

Author: Jack Kerouac,  Windblown World: The Journals of Jack Kerouac 1947-1954
Quote: Don't tell them too much about your soul. They're waiting for just that.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: I have said that the soul is not more than the body,And I have said that the body is not more than the soul,And nothing, not God, is greater to one than one's-self is,

Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,  Chains
Quote: She cannot chain my soul. Yes, she could hurt me. She'd already done so...I would bleed, or not. Scar, or not. Live, or not. But she could not hurt my soul, not unless I gave it to her.

Author: Marian Wright Edelman
Quote: Never work just for money or for power. They won't save your soul or help you sleep at night.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: re-examine all you have been told in school or church or in any book, and dismiss whatever insults your own soul; and your very flesh shall be a great poem, and have the richest fluency, not only in its words, but in the silent lines of its lips and face, and between the lashes of your eyes, and in every motion and joint of your body.[From the preface to Leaves Grass]

Author: Charles Bukowski,  You Get So Alone at Times That it Just Makes Sense
Quote: I paid, got up, walkedto the door, openedit.I heard the mansay, "that guy'snuts."out on the street Iwalked northfeelingcuriouslyhonored.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I’ve always seen this in you, ever since you were a little girl — this hunger to love other people into their highest selves and it’s what has made me irreversibly and just so forever in love with you.

Author: John Donne,  The Complete English Poems
Quote: Love's mysteries in souls do grow,But yet the body is his book.

Author: Vanna Bonta,  Flight: A Quantum Fiction Novel
Quote: The illusion is we are only physical.

Author: George Eliot,  Middlemarch
Quote: Certainly the determining acts of her life were not ideally beautiful. They were the mixed result of young and novel impulse struggling amidst the conditions of an imperfect social state, in which great feelings will often take the aspect of error, and great faith the aspect of illusion.

Author: Marina Diamandis Marina and the Diamonds
Quote: Been there, done that, got the t-shirt.Sold my soul and yeah, the truth hurts.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: Stop trying to be less of who you are. Let this time in your life cut you open and drain all of the things that are holding you back.

Author: A. Edward Newton,  A Magnificent Farce And Other Diversions Of A Book Collector
Quote: Who was it who said, "I hold the buying of more books than one can peradventure read, as nothing less than the soul's reaching towards infinity; which is the only thing that raises us above the beasts that perish?"Whoever it was, I agree with him.

Author: Caroline Myss,  Anatomy of the Spirit
Quote: What drains your spirit drains your body. What fuels your spirit fuels your body.

Author: John Keats
Quote: Poetry should be great and unobtrusive, a thing which enters into one's soul, and does not startle it or amaze it with itself, but with its subject.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  A House of Pomegranates
Quote: What men call the shadow of the body is not the shadow of the body, but is the body of the soul.

Author: M.D. Birmingham
Quote: The love of money is the root of all evil, therefore selfishness must be the seed.

Author: John O'Donohue,  Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom
Quote: Your soul is the priestess of memory, selecting, sifting, and ultimately gathering your vanishing days toward presence.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I love him in ways that I can’t explain to other people. They don’t understand… it’s not their fault.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: So with curious eyes and sick surmiseWe watched him day by day,And wondered if each one of usWould end the self-same way,For none can tell to what red HellHis sightless soul may stray.

Author: Sanober Khan,  A Thousand Flamingos
Quote: Sometimes I think,I need a spare heart to feel all the things I feel.

Author: Stacey Kade,  Body & Soul
Quote: What happened to you?"she asked."Ben was feeling artistic. Wanted to rearrange my face.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: There is nothing worse for the lying soul than the mirror of reality.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: Shine your soul with the same egoless humility as the rainbow and no matter where you go in this world or the next, love will find you, attend you, and bless you.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I feel a resurgence of my 6-year-old self… that little warrior, goddess of a girl reminding me of who I was when I was little, before the world got its hands on me.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: If ever I was running, it was towards you.

Author: James Joyce,  A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
Quote: The soul ... has a slow and dark birth, more mysterious than the birth of the body. When the soul of a man is born in this country there are nets flung at it to hold it back from flight. You talk to me of nationality, language, religion. I shall try to fly by those nets.

Author: Munia Khan
Quote: Ocean separates lands, not souls..

Author: Plato
Quote: Knowledge is the food of the soul.

Author: Toba Beta,  Master of Stupidity
Quote: Charisma is the fragrance of soul.

Author: Terence McKenna
Quote: It is the imagination that argues for the Divine Spark within human beings. It is literally a decent of the World's Soul into all of us.

Author: Jeremy Aldana
Quote: Thoughts are as simple as the process…a message from the soul; conveyed through the heart; received in the mind

Author: Toba Beta,  Betelgeuse Incident: Insiden Bait Al-Jauza
Quote: There are words in the soul of a newborn baby, wanting and waiting to be written.

Author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
Quote: You have to be able to center yourself, to let all of your emotions go. Don’t ever forget that you play with your soul as well as your body.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems
Quote: The Soul selects her own Society.

Author: Kimberly Derting,  The Essence
Quote: In the privacy of my dreams, I'm a warrior.

Author: J.D. Stroube,  Caged in Darkness
Quote: Their screams would echo through the house and reverberate against my eardrums until my mind would fracture. Years went by and with each fracture; I lost a piece of my soul until I became lost and empty inside.

Author: Steven Pinker,  How the Mind Works
Quote: The supposedly immaterial soul, we now know, can be bisected with a knife, altered by chemicals, started or stopped by electricity, and extinguished by a sharp blow or by insufficient oxygen.

Author: Seneca
Quote: The final hour when we cease to exist does not itself bring death; it merely of itself completes the death-process. We reach death at that moment, but we have been a long time on the way.

Author: Edmond Rostand,  Cyrano de Bergerac
Quote: My soul, be satisfied with flowers,With fruit, with weeds even; but gather themIn the one garden you may call your own.

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: lean in to kiss mein all the placeswhere the acheis the most special.

Author: James Redfield,  The Tenth Insight: Holding the Vision
Quote: This is [her] soul group.’What do you mean?’It’s a group of souls with whom she resonates closely.

Author: Joe Hill,  Horns
Quote: The soul is an irrational, indivisible equation that perfectly expresses one thing: you. The soul would be no good to the devil if it could be destroyed. And it is not lost when placed in Satan's care, as is so often said. He always know exactly how to put his finger on it.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
Quote: I was ripped from my body, I was less than spirit, less than the meanest ghost . . . but still, I was alive.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  American Gods
Quote: That is the eternal folly of man. To be chasing after the sweet flesh, without realizing that it is simply a pretty cover for the bones.

Author: Molly Friedenfeld
Quote: Focus on faith and grow your roots strong and deep so no one can make you believe in something that is not good for your soul.

Author: Thomas Harris,  The Silence of the Lambs
Quote: He lives down in a ribcage in the dry leaves of a heart.

Author: Danielle Steel,  Wanderlust
Quote: There was something much greater she needed to feed her soul, and perhaps one day soon she would go...

Author: Eric Clapton
Quote: Musically, he was like an old man in a boy's skin.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I really believe that there is an invisible red thread tied between him and me, and that it has stretched and tangled for years — across oceans and lifetimes. I know that it won’t break because our souls are tied.

Author: Daniel Nayeri,  Another Faust
Quote: It's not worth losing your soul to win a guy.

Author: Laini Taylor,  Lips Touch: Three Times
Quote: Is that all souls are for? For when we die?""No. They're for living, too.

Author: James Baldwin,  Giovanni's Room
Quote: But it was not the room’s disorder which was frightening; it was the fact that when one began searching for the key to this disorder, one realized that it was not to be found in any of the usual places. For this was not a matter of habit or circumstance or temperament; it was a matter of punishment and grief.

Author: Roman Payne,  Cities & Countries
Quote: This was how it was with travel: one city gives you gifts, another robs you. One gives you the heart’s affections, the other destroys your soul. Cities and countries are as alive and feeling, as fickle and uncertain as people. Their degrees of love and devotion are as varying as with any human relation. Just as one is good, another is bad.

Author: J.D. Stroube,  Caged by Damnation
Quote: Even knowing that my presence brought a shadow over the lives of my loved ones, I can't regret the experiences I've had with them. They gave me life, becoming an integral part of my soul. They healed me when I was broken and somehow they recovered those parts of me, I thought lost forever.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I met a boy whose eyes showed me that the past, present and future were all the same thing.

Author: Truth Devour,  Unrequited
Quote: You have to appreciate where you have come from to know who you are in the present and whom you would like to be in the future.

Author: Oswald Chambers
Quote: Am I as spontaneously kind to God as I used to be, or am I only expecting God to be kind to me? Am I full of the little things that cheer His heart over me, or am I whimpering because things are going hardly with me? There is no joy in the soul that has forgotten what God prizes.

Author: Graham Greene,  Doctor Fischer of Geneva or The Bomb Party
Quote: He's satisfied with himself. If you have a soul you can't be satisfied.

Author: Elizabeth von Arnim,  The Solitary Summer
Quote: I want to be as idle as I can, so that my soul may have time to grow.

Author: Colleen Coble,  Fire Dancer
Quote: There is more to a soul than what others see

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Pilgrimage
Quote: We must never stop dreaming. Dreams provide nourishment for the soul, just as a meal does for the body. Many times in our lives we see our dreams shattered and our desires frustrated, but we have to continue dreaming. If we don't, our soul dies, and agape cannot reach it.

Author: Coco J. Ginger
Quote: He offered her power, money, status...a giant prison, all in exchange for only...her soul.

Author: Marsilio Ficino
Quote: The soul exists partly in eternity and partly in time.

Author: Richelle Mead,  Storm Born
Quote: I've heard that the soul often recognizes truth when it hears it, even if the mind does not.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I could watch him do this until morning — never asking questions and never interrupting his work. I worship quietly — his intense focus and attention to detail and then, out of no where, I realize the inconvenient, inappropriate truth: ‘I love this man… and it has swallowed me.

Author: Truth Devour,  Unrequited
Quote: You are the ruler of my heart. There is no measure greater than this.

Author: Erlend Loe,  Naïve. Super
Quote: I still don't know if things fit together, or if everything will be all right in the end. But I believe that something means something. I believe in cleansing the soul through fun and games. I also believe in love. And I have several good friends, and just one bad one.

Author: Kelly Cutrone,  If You Have to Cry, Go Outside: And Other Things Your Mother Never Told You
Quote: Dreams won't always take you on a straight path to destiny, but they're usually related to what your soul wants for you.

Author: Thomas à Kempis,  The Inner Life
Quote: A sure way of retaining the grace of heaven is to disregard outward appearances, and diligently to cultivate such things as foster amendment of life and fervour of soul, rather than to cultivate those qualities that seem most popular.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I know that your soul is on life support and that you feel lost and like you’re completely spinning out of control, but you’re finding yourself — here, tonight… even in this darkness.

Author: Melina Marchetta,  The Piper's Son
Quote: Play me something that makes me feel;This soul inside me is made of steel.Brain is breathing, but heart’s not beatingAnd, babe, I need you to make things real.Walk inside me without silence,Kill the past and change the tense.Empty gnawing and the ache is soaring;Take me places that make more sense.

Author: Patrick Süskind,  Perfume: The Story of a Murderer
Quote: And suddenly solitude fell across his heart like a dusty reflection. He closed his eyes. The dark doors within him opened and he entered. The next performance in the theater of Grenouille's soul was beginning.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Othello
Quote: This look of thine will hurl my soul from heaven.

Author: Jocelyn Murray
Quote: Sometimes it takes great suffering to pierce the soul and open it up to greatness

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: What is happening to me happens to all fruits that grow ripe. It is the honey in my veins that makes my blood thicker, and my soul quieter.

Author: Dean Hughes,  Far From Home
Quote: War is the greatest evil Satan has invented to corrupt our hearts and souls. We should honor our soldiers, but we should never honor war.

Author: C.S. Friedman,  When True Night Falls
Quote: I sold my soul for knowledge of the future, only to have that very pact render me forever ignorant (Gerald Tarrant).

Author: Edith Hamilton
Quote: I came to the Greeks early, and I found answers in them. Greece's great men let all their acts turn on the immortality of the soul. We don't really act as if we believed in the soul's immortality and that's why we are where we are today.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Seven times have I despised my soul: The sixth time when she despised the ugliness of a face, and knew not that it was one of her own masks.

Author: Terence McKenna
Quote: The artist’s task is to save the soul of mankind; and anything less is a dithering while Rome burns. Because of the artists, who are self-selected, for being able to journey into the Other, if the artists cannot find the way, then the way cannot be found.

Author: Tabitha Suzuma,  A Note of Madness
Quote: The sight of such aching beauty would infuse his soul with pain.

Author: Caitlin Kittredge,  The Iron Thorn
Quote: Crows don’t take from you,” Dean said. “They give your soul wings.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Belief consists in accepting the affirmations of the soul; unbelief, in denying them.

Author: Myla Goldberg,  Bee Season
Quote: She has often felt that her outsides were too dull for her insides, that deep within her there was something better than what everyone else could see.

Author: Farahad Zama,  The Marriage Bureau for Rich People
Quote: There is no point in getting rich if we lose our soul along the way.

Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Dispossessed
Quote: Where does your soul go, when you die in Hell?

Author: Landon Parham,  First Night of Summer
Quote: All things, even the deepest sorrow or the most profound happiness are all temporary. Hope is fuel for the soul, without hope, forward motion ceases.

Author: W. Somerset Maugham,  The Summing Up
Quote: Every production of an artist should be the expression of an adventure of his soul.

Author: Beth Nimmo,  Rachel's Tears: The Spiritual Journey of Columbine Martyr Rachel Scott
Quote: I writeNotFor the sake of gloryNot For the sake of fameNotFor the sake of successBut for the sake of my soul

Author: Oscar Wilde,  Reviews
Quote: Behind the perfection of a man's style, must lie the passion of a man's soul.

Author: Truth Devour,  Unrequited
Quote: Never surrender to you're passions. Dream and live to excess.

Author: David Whyte
Quote: ...wanting soul life without the dark, warming intelligence of personal doubt is like expecting an egg without the brooding heat of the mother hen.

Author: Carlos María Domínguez,  The House of Paper
Quote: It is often much harder to get rid of books than to acquire them. They stick to us in that pact of need and oblivion we make with them, witnesses to a moment in our lives we will never see again. While they are still there, it is part of us.

Author: Prem Prakash,  The Yoga of Spiritual Devotion A Modern Translation of the Narada Bhakti Sutras
Quote: Each soul has its own note to sing in the divine chorus and no voice is more important than another. (94)

Author: The Killers,  The Killers, Hot Fuss
Quote: I've got soul, but I'm not a souldier.

Author: Kate Karyus Quinn,  Another Little Piece
Quote: Confession is good for the soul, they say. I'd imagine this is true. But my sins were too convoluted. And from the little I understand--too damning.

Author: Richard Flanagan
Quote: Writing is not lying, nor is it theft. It is a journey and search for transparency between one’s words and one’s soul.

Author: J.D. Stroube,  Caged in Darkness
Quote: My parents had torn through my innocence and left me with a tar-like substance that was corrupting what was left of me. I could feel it at night; slithering and curling around my soul as it slowly devoured me. It was draining my energy and replacing it with an evil I was afraid to confront.

Author: Marikit dR. Camba,  Vividly Vague
Quote: Breathe next to me. And I will capture a piece of your soul along with mine.

Author: Bahaa Taher,  الحب في المنفى
Quote: Misery is a scar on the soul, that if it begins in childhood, it lasts the whole lifetime. I understand that no two scars are alike, but I also ask myself; even if these scars are not alike, aren’t these things engraved on our souls signed by which we know each other?Aren’t we also alike?

Author: Caryll Houselander,  This War Is the Passion
Quote: Christ asks for a home in your soul, where he can be at rest with you, where he can talk easily to you, where you and he, alone together, can laugh and be silent and be delighted with one another.

Author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
Quote: This path was not that of my conscious choosing. But after persistent subconscious confrontation, I have finally embraced what is, 'souly' for me...and I am thankful, when called upon, to be able to share and give to those who seek their own way of the path.

Author: Whitney Barbetti,  Ten Below Zero
Quote: I was naked under his gaze. Skin was just that: skin. But to see your soul stripped, laid bare for the eyes of someone you barely knew-that was terrifying.

Author: Henry Ward Beecher
Quote: The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: Everything hurts right now and nothing is helping because as the pain is getting worse — so is the love.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: Does our purpose on Earth directly link to the people whom we end up meeting? Are our relationships and experiences actually the required dots that connect and then lead us to our ultimate destinies?

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I fantasize the night sky to be like a cosmic blue print of my life as I close my eyes and unbutton my heart…. just in case anyone up there is listening.

Author: James Hillman
Quote: I can no longer be sure whether the psyche is in me or whether I'm in the psyche...

Author: Jarod Kintz,  At even one penny, this book would be overpriced. In fact, free is too expensive, because you'd still waste time by reading it.
Quote: I had an out-of-body experience so strange that it felt normal. You see, my soul, or essence, had left my body and went and inhabited the body of my clone. So I wasn’t in my body, and yet I was. Or maybe none of that happened, and I was just in a delirious, sleep-deprived state.

Author: SARK,  Succulent Wild Woman
Quote: My body is precious and not separate from my soul.

Author: Kyung-sook Shin,  Please Look After Mom
Quote: You're paved in my heart like an old road. Like the pebbles in a pebble field, dirt in dirt, dust in dust, cobwebs in cobwebs.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: Human is a suffered mind but an enlightened soul.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I’ve grown up defined by this desperate, undeniable, ‘can’t breathe’ kind of space inside of myself and I’m afraid that the diagnosis is fatal.

Author: Lisa Kleypas,  Tempt Me at Twilight
Quote: It was a kiss to level mountains and shake stars from the sky. It was a kiss to make angels faint and demons weep...a passionate, demanding, soul-searing kiss that nearly knocked the earth off its axis.

Author: Sri Chinmoy
Quote: If we can feel that it is not our voice, not our fingers, but some reality deep inside our heart which is expressing itself, then we will know that it is the soul’s music.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,  Voices of the Night
Quote: Life is real! Life is earnest!And the grave is not its goal;Dust thou are, to dust thou returnest,Was not spoken of the soul.

Author: Julie Kagawa
Quote: It would be dreadfullyironic, I mused, if once I earned a soul, I forgot everything about being fey, including all my memories of her. That sort of ending seemedappropriately tragic; the smitten fey creature becomes human but forgets why he wanted to in the first place. Old fairy tales loved that sort of irony.

Author: Sanober Khan,  Turquoise Silence
Quote: ...so i will greet youin a wayall loved thingsare meant to be greetedwith a tear in my heartand a poem in my eye.

Author: Peter Kreeft,  Pocket Handbook of Christian Apologetics
Quote: Conscience is thus explained only as the voice of God in the soul.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I know that this process of ‘me changing my life’ doesn’t just end once I set fire to this list of things I hate about myself. Tonight isn’t as much of a new beginning as it is a violent end and I know the real work hasn’t even started yet.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I’m going to follow this invisible red thread until I find myself again… until I finally figure out… who I’m meant to be.

Author: Robert McKee,  Story: Style, Structure, Substance, and the Principles of Screenwriting
Quote: No matter our talent, we all know in the midnight of our souls that 90 percent of what we do is less than our best.

Author: Sarah Kane
Quote: Body and soul can never be marriedI need to become who I already am and will bellow forever at this incongruity which has committed me to hell

Author: Markus Zusak,  Getting the Girl
Quote: If her soul ever leaks, I want it to land on me.

Author: Tanith Lee,  Death's Master
Quote: The soul is a magician. Only living flesh hampers it.

Author: Doug Cooper,  Outside In
Quote: There’s a drive in a lost soul—in one that is searching for acceptance, companionship, belonging, whatever you want to call it. The slightest coincidence ignites a spark that one hopes will lead to something meaningful.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: I am an empty mind with an empty body and with an empty soul. I am neither haunting for anything nor something.

Author: David Malouf
Quote: Words his soul danced to.

Author: Jeff Lindsay,  Darkly Dreaming Dexter
Quote: It was such an unexpected and genuine smile that if I only had a soul I'm sure I would have felt quite guilty.

Author: Sarah McLean
Quote: Meditation is an essential travel partner on your journey of personal transformation. Meditation connects you with your soul,and this connection gives you access to your intuition, your heartfelt desires, your integrity, and the inspiration to create a life you love.

Author: Rudolfo Anaya,  Bless Me, Ultima
Quote: I had been afraid of the awful presence of the river, which was the soul of the river, but through her [Ultima] I learned that my spirit shared in the spirit of all things.

Author: Ann Brashares,  Sisterhood Everlasting
Quote: She felt like parts of her soul were missing, had left her body long ago. It had happened not in Greece three months ago, but long before that. It was in Greece that she'd realized those parts had left her and were not coming back.

Author: Hiro Mashima
Quote: We'll stop it, even if my body crumbles to bits I'll stop it with my soul!

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: If I discover within myself a desire which no experience in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that I was made for another world.

Author: Werner Von Braun
Quote: Everything science has taught me strengthens my belief in the continuity of our spiritual existence after death. I believe in an immortal soul. Science has proved that nothing disintegrates into nothingness. Life and soul, therefore, cannot disintegrate into nothingness, and so are immortal.

Author: Ogwo David Emenike
Quote: Happy is the soul that has a friend. Happier is the soul that trusts in the truth of the heart of a friend. Happiest is the soul that knows the solemnity of friendship and honours its laws.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: The conception of each star was at the point of no return; of a desperate soul struggling to master the winds!

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: Something, somewhere, knows what’s best for me and promises to keep sending me people and experiences to light my way as long as I live in gratitude and keep paying attention to the signs.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: Let this time in your life cut you open and drain all of the things that are holding you back. I’m going to help you forgive the things that you won’t let yourself forget.

Author: Eleesha
Quote: We cannot face up to what lies ahead, without facing up to what lies within.

Author: Tiffany Madison
Quote: No man owns me. All man can do is practice the timeless, criminal art of threatening to separate my soul from her physical host.

Author: Edward Abbey
Quote: What we need now are heroes and heroines, about a million of them, one brave deed is worth a thousand books. Sentiment without action is the ruin of the soul.

Author: Steve Goodier
Quote: THE GOOD LIFE requires that we take pleasure in new things; A GOOD LIFE requires that we take pleasure in moments.To enjoy THE GOOD LIFE we have to get ahead; to enjoy A GOOD LIFE we have to make the trip worthwhile.THE GOOD LIFE is supported by feeding our pocketbooks; A GOOD LIFE is supported by feeding our souls.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Beauty is the virtue of the body as virtue is the beauty of the soul

Author: Charles Baudelaire,  Intimate Journals
Quote: Abolishers of the soul (materialists) are necessarily abolishers of hell, they, certainly, are interested. At all events, they are people who fear to live again--lazy people.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I just want your voice aimed at me again. I want to absorb the direction of your eyes…

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: Your personal truth is your gift to the world.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: We made love outdoors—without a roof, I like most, without stove, my favorite place, assuming the weather be fair and balmy, and the earth beneath be clean. Our souls intertwined and dripping with dew, and our love for each other was seen. Our love for the world was new.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  The Complete Poems
Quote: THE soul should always stand ajar, That if the heaven inquire,He will not be obliged to wait, Or shy of troubling her.Depart, before the host has slid The bolt upon the door,To seek for the accomplished guest, -- Her visitor no more.

Author: Therese Anne Fowler,  Z: A Novel of Zelda Fitzgerald
Quote: If the river has a soul, it's a peaceful one. If it has a lesson to impart, that lesson is patience. There will be drought, it says; there will be floods; the ice will form, the ice will melt; the water will flow and blend into the river's brackish mouth, then join the ocean between Lewes and Cape May, endlessly, forever, amen.

Author: Basil the Great
Quote: Words are truly the image of the soul.

Author: Annie Dillard,  Teaching a Stone to Talk: Expeditions and Encounters
Quote: The soul may ask God for anything, and never fail.

Author: Ann Aguirre,  Aftermath
Quote: For I need this scar over my heart to remind me. Crazy as it sounds, if I can bear the wound on my body, it lessens what I must carry on my soul. How he knew that about me, I cannot fathom.

Author: Karen Hackel,  The Whisper of Your Soul
Quote: Let your wisdom guide youOn your own personal journey By listening to your heartYour soul will be alight And let you beAll that you are intended to be

Author: Josef Pieper,  Happiness and Contemplation
Quote: ... the greatest menace to our capacity for contemplation is the incessant fabrication of tawdry empty stimuli which kill the receptivity of the soul.

Author: Alysha Speer
Quote: I felt like some part of my soul was ripped out and put under a microscope for criticizing.

Author: Toba Beta
Quote: A good reading strengthens the soul.

Author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
Quote: While fear depletes power, faith gives wings for the soul’s elevation.

Author: Ilyas Kassam
Quote: We think to dance, and dance in thought. But to hibernate in the mind, is to bring upon us an apocalypse of the Soul.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Zahir
Quote: fanaticism is the only way to put an end to the doubts that constantly trouble the human soul.

Author: Omar Khayyám,  Quatrains
Quote: In monasteries, seminaries, retreats and synagogues, they fear hell and seek paradise. Those who know the mysteries of God never let that seed be planted in their souls.

Author: Marlene Van Niekerk,  Agaat
Quote: ...a butterfly is like the soul of a person, it dries out in captivity.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  The Casual Vacancy
Quote: She had a way of moving that moved him as much as music, which was what moved him most of all. Surely the spirit animating that pearless body must be unusual too? Why would nature make a vessel like that, if not to contain something still more valuable?

Author: Parker J. Palmer,  Let Your Life Speak: Listening for the Voice of Vocation
Quote: We must come together in ways that respect the solitude of the soul that avoid the unconscious violence we do when we try to save each other that evoke our capacity to hold another life without dishonoring its mystery never trying to coerce the other into meeting our own needs.

Author: Hermann Hesse,  Beneath the Wheel
Quote: When a tree is polled, it will sprout new shoots nearer its roots. A soul that is ruined in the bud will frequently return to the springtime of its beginnings and its promise-filled childhood, as though it could discover new hopes there and retie the broken threads of life. The shoots grow rapidly and eagerly, but it is only a sham life that will never be a genuine tree.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title
Quote: Is there a word halfway between hello and goodbye? Because that’s the word my soul is trying to say.

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: CALL YOURSELFLook deep in the mirrorAnd say: 'I LOVE YOU'And immediatelyAn electric current willRipple throughout your soulAnd burst through your eyesLike shooting starsDancing across the skiesIn ecstasy.To tell your soul you love it -Is like rememberingWHO YOU AREAfter being in a comaFor a hundred years.Your face will beam the lightOf a hundred galaxies.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  Mere Christianity
Quote: Remember, we Christians think man lives for ever. Therefore, what really matters is those little marks or twists on the central, inside part of the soul which are going to turn it, in the long run, into a heavenly or a hellish creature.

Author: Stacey Kade
Quote: I couldn't loose somebody else like that, without even the chance to say good-bye. Not again. Not her.

Author: Edna Hatlestad Hong
Quote: A guilty suffering spirit is more open to grace than an apathetic or smug soul.' - Bread & Wine (day 5)

Author: Fernando Pessoa,  The Book of Disquiet
Quote: My soul is a black maelstrom, a great madness spinning about a vacuum, the swirling of a vast ocean around a hole in the void, and in the waters, more like whirlwinds than waters, float images of all I ever saw or heard in the world: houses, faces, books, boxes, snatches of music and fragments of voices, all caught up in a sinister, bottomless whirlpool.

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: The spirit is one of the most neglected parts of man by doctors and scientists around the world. Yet, it is as vital to our health as the heart and mind. It's time for science to examine the many facets of the soul. The condition of our soul is usually the source of many sicknesses.

Author: Jeremy Aldana
Quote: The Memory Of You Is Like A Drug To Me

Author: Alysha Speer,  Sharden
Quote: And though I was currently living a fairy tale, some part of my soul knew that happiness couldn't last forever. I didn't deserve a happily ever after, and there weren't many other cards to play when that was the truth.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: من شأن السجود أن يصبح باردًا ويغرق في الملل المألوف إن تركت انتباهك يشت عنه .ولكن إن حافظت على تركيزك ، فإنك تتحمل بذلك مسؤولية الحفاظ على روحك

Author: J.D. Stroube,  Caged by Damnation
Quote: I could see her will leaving and death seeping through her skin to skewer her soul.

Author: Ann Aguirre,  Aftermath
Quote: . . . and I don’t expect him to suborn his life into mine any more than I would change my dreams for him. We’re not one soul, one being, however much we love each other.

Author: Kevin Brockmeier,  The View from the Seventh Layer
Quote: You have a pet theory, one you have been turning over for years, that life itself is a kind of Rube Goldberg device, an extremely complicated machine designed to carry out the extremely simple task of constructing your soul.

Author: W. Somerset Maugham,  Of Human Bondage
Quote: I now, weak, old, diseased, poor, dying, hold still my soul in my hands, and I regret nothing.

Author: Ma Jaya Sati Bhagavati,  The 11 Karmic Spaces: Choosing Freedom from the Patterns That Bind You
Quote: Spiritual yearning is the homesickness of the soul.

Author: Aleksandar Hemon
Quote: I gradually became aware that my interiority was inseparable from my exteriority, that the geography of my city was the geography of my soul.

Author: Jeffrey Carver
Quote: Write from the soul, not from some notion about what you think the marketplace wants.The market is fickle; the soul is eternal'.

Author: Brian Rathbone,  Inherited Danger
Quote: The souls of heroes are forged by the gods and tempered with the pain of life.

Author: Jessica Verday,  The Haunted
Quote: I'm your other half. (...) I'll carry your heartbeat in mine.

Author: Michel de Montaigne
Quote: The least strained and most natural ways of the soul are the most beautiful; the best occupations are the least forced.

Author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana
Quote: Be thankful for a breath of fresh air to be alive and well. Allow love and happiness to penetrate throughout your mind and soul. Take time to relax and live in the moment, the now, the present. Enjoy today.

Author: A.M. Homes,  May We Be Forgiven
Quote: How can I tell anyone that there has always lived within me a rusty sense of disgust-a dull, brackish water that I suspect is my soul?

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: it’s that sense of powerlessness that destroyed my soul. i cannot be as good as i would like to be.nor as bad as i think i need to be.i think you have the same doubts that your goodness was not rewarded

Author: Thomas Carlyle,  On Heroes, Hero Worship and the Heroic in History
Quote: There needs not a great soul to make a hero; there needs a god-created soul which will be true to its origin; that will be a great soul!

Author: Craig Werner,  Higher Ground: Stevie Wonder, Aretha Franklin, Curtis Mayfield, and the Rise and Fall of American Soul
